Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the amount of state government spending by stating that it is at an all-time high, without taking into account inflation-adjusted figures.
Understate: The claim understates the impact of inflation on the state government spending, as adjusting for inflation shows that spending is not actually at an all-time high.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or data to back up the statement that state government spending is at an all-time high.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the assumption that raising taxes is unnecessary because government spending is already at an all-time high, without considering other factors or alternative explanations for the budget gap.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the budget gap, such as changes in revenue sources or economic factors, and solely focuses on government spending.
